text:
Feedback from the crew:

The problem is that we need multiple env. for development purposes:
• Acceptation, for client delivery and beta testing (current enterprise sandbox of plan)
• Staging, for internal QA
• Local, for every developer to work on locally
Acceptation is linked with Github actions (HS best practices), this makes is not suiteable as a live development env. because every code change needs a github push in order to become available on the HS. Imagine sending an email for every text line you type on slack .

*Is it not possible to open up those permission for at least the local env. of the B/E dev working on this module?*

So what I can tell you is that you can create test portals with a HubSpot developer account. Especially if you are using the HubSpot CLI tool, you can authorize with multiple portals. This means in your HubSpot yaml file you can have a reference to each portal that you work with and deploy to each portal individually.
<@U04UF7BNBK4> thanks for the input. Do I understand correct that we can link multiple dev-sandbox accounts to 1 HubSpot enterprise account (what is needed for the permissions to be ok)?

A portal has its on set of available features, and depending on the permissions of the user you can use more features.

A sandbox shares the same available features as the actual portal. A testportal has more features activated so that testing is easier.
